text: We don't see reps go rogue too frequently - that I'm aware of, at least. For time-sensitive requests, we're happy to rush production,  but we also provide the brand resources/tools they need to create their own content if the window is too short to fulfill a more comprehensive request (e.g., Google Slides or Keynote templates). We have company-wide social policies & rarely see anyone go "off message."

elements.text: We don't see reps go rogue too frequently - that I'm aware of, at least. For time-sensitive requests, we're happy to rush production,  but we also provide the brand resources/tools they need to create their own content if the window is too short to fulfill a more comprehensive request (e.g., Google Slides or Keynote templates). We have company-wide social policies & rarely see anyone go "off message."

text:
Happy Friday everyone! Since a major theme of content marketing is usefulness and education, given the current situation, does anyone have any good examples of companies creating helpful/useful content to help their clients navigate the business/economic landscape?

Open to any industry - more curious about ways people are thinking outside the box. For example, Tableau used their resources to create data visualizations to help people stay informed (<https://www.tableau.com/covid-19-coronavirus-data-resources>) - and Facebook put a guide together to help businesses navigate a challenging times: <https://www.facebook.com/business/boost/resource>.

attachments.title: Business Resource Hub: Build Resilience During Challenging Times
attachments.text: Help your business manage through and build resilience during challenging times. Read our latest resources.
attachments.fallback: Facebook for Business: Business Resource Hub: Build Resilience During Challenging Times
